as you selected diy, would be grateful f:
I use syncthing to backup my files but need to look at remote hosting as then I can access my Tiddlwiki when out and about.
I was caring for my partner through the last three years of his life and so largely housebound - hence a home network solution

outside of plugins, palettes and other i:
I use backlinks to give me a Zettelkasten effect

so every tiddler has this code at the bottom:

<<list-links "[all[current]backlinks[]sort[title]]">>

Not very exciting
what are we doing well? prompts for thin:
I like that it is open source and works even on Termux on my Android phone - which is where it started out.
I am aware I am a small cog and don't use Tiddlywiki to its full potential
and there are kinks that need sorting and I need to engage to maintain it.
I come from a Linux background - next year I will have been using Linux as my sole OS
for 25 years. Thanks to receiving Windows Me on a new computer and it being so buggy that
I moved to Linux to recover my files.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
I may leave TW I have to leave that open but I do not at present see that as likely.

potential small black clouds on the horizon are:
- having .tid files that are not compatible with a new version of TW and no easy path to convert them
- needing to host my TW remotely in the node.js format so I can access it remotely and that not being possible.

My partner died last month and so things are changing so I cannot offer help at this time.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
